alert.note: Alert for Northern Stillwater; Southwestern Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 12:43AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Stillwater and southwestern Yellowstone Counties through 130 AM MDT... At 1242 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Billings West End to 9 miles southeast of Laurel. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Billings, Laurel, Lockwood, Shepherd, Huntley, Billings Heights, Billings West End, Acton, Park City and Molt. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
